intro: Speea triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves and yellowish-green sap. Native to South America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
